data: NICU Treatment of IV Extravasation Injuries (Module)
Medications
Refer to treatment protocol and monitoring for IV Extravasation Injuries
Consider administration of:  a) phentolamine as an antidote for extravasation of vasopressors  b) hyaluronidase in severe extravasation injuries
hyaluronidase
120 unit, subcutaneous, as directed, drug form: inj
phentolamine
0.1 mg/kg, subcutaneous, as directed, drug form: inj
Opioids
morphine
50 mcg/kg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: inj
fentanyl
0.5 mcg/kg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: inj
1 mcg/kg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: inj
2 mcg/kg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: inj
fentanyl
1 mcg/kg, buccal, pre-procedure, drug form: inj
2 mcg/kg, buccal, pre-procedure, drug form: inj
Consults/Referrals
Consider consultation with Pediatric Plastic Surgery
